column4: I have introduced a series of bills to address the problems at the heart of our coronavirus response, including legislation with @BillPascrell to increase pandemic preparedness and a bill to speed up COVID testing results.

I am deeply concerned about reports of a COVID case at the Paramus Veterans Memorial Home, especially after the tragic outbreak earlier this year. Concerns about nursing home preparedness, competency, and transparency are real.

The pandemic has exacerbated the digital divide and made it even clearer that NJ families and business need strong, reliable broadband access. But today the @FCC again chose corporate profits over innovation, access, and a free and open internet.   #netneutrality
If you need a COVID test in Essex County, there are lots of opportunities next week: https://t.co/UzfwW5nqT6

I’m holding a webinar with @NewJerseyEDA on Friday to help small businesses with applications to the COVID relief grant program funded by the CARES Act. Registration and timing info here: https://t.co/wBKfW0bjY5
We received news that our child care provider received a positive COVID-19 test. Luckily, everyone in our family has tested negative, however, we will be quarantining according to CDC guidelines.
RT @NewDemCoalition: #NewDem Freshman Whip @RepSherrill and #NewDem Vice Chairs @RepDelBene & @RepTerriSewell introduced the SPEEDY COVID-1…
It was an honor to join @RepDonaldPayne and NJ electeds at @MHAEssexMorris to discuss policies to support those with mental and behavioral health challenges. #endthestigma
Reminder, free COVID testing is available. Here's October info for Passaic and Essex Counties: https://t.co/vCWPm1Ng3T

Appreciated the opportunity to visit the Islamic Center of Morris County to speak about COVID relief, my support for the NO BAN Act, and the casework services that my team can provide. https://t.co/vi9rEng3nQ

Yesterday was the 23rd emergency food distribution Essex County has sponsonsored during the COVID crisis. Thanks to @Joe_D_EssexExec & the county commissioners for bringing this back to Montclair. https://t.co/PtrTKgk9ys
I visited @Zufall_Health’s flu shot clinic at @montclairstateu this morning. The last thing we need is a flu outbreak, so please do you part and get a flu shot! https://t.co/TgVXn2D9rm
RT @passaic_county: #COVID19 Testing: https://t.co/or7fUxInIh

Great to see everyone yesterday at our 2nd Annual First Responders Meet & Greet. We had the opportunity to thank our EMS Leaders, Police Chiefs, Fire Chiefs, County Sheriffs & Prosecutors for their work during COVID, present on federal grant opportunities, and answer questions. https://t.co/GJfWegIcJL
Join my next telephone townhall on October 8th @ 5PM. We'll discuss COVID relief & feature a panel on managing COVID concerns, work schedules, and remote school. Details here: https://t.co/CTgcbP6HI4
Good overview by @wired on my bill w/ @RepDelBene and @RepTerriSewell to incentivize labs to speed up COVID test results. https://t.co/BLW82lL6We
Grateful to join @calvaryconnex's uplifting back-to-school outdoor service. I am so inspired by the way communities like Calvary Baptist have cared for each other during COVID.
Was pleased to help pass a slate of bills yesterday to help vets. Key provisions: increased access to telehealth and streamlining disability claims info.
Proud to help lead this effort to secure COVID relief for NJ families https://t.co/zKSQpU2Xbz
I will keep fighting for the resources our residents, nonprofits, and small businesses need to recover from the real economic damage caused by this pandemic.

All four counties in #NJ11, residents, municipalities, medical providers, nonprofits, small businesses, and educational organizations in the district have received over $4 billion in federal coronavirus relief since March.

Today I announced that counties and municipalities in #NJ11 will receive more than $7.3 million in CARES Act funding to provide temporary rental assistance to families and individuals at the greatest risk of eviction due to the pandemic. https://t.co/qTxxNR0XIF

Essex County Residents: Make an appt for free COVID testing Tuesday in Verona. 

➡️ https://t.co/ukn9WhI6uT https://t.co/nrtNZDoHvd
L'Shanah Tovah! May 5781 bring a sweet, happy, and healthy new year to all our friends and neighbors. https://t.co/G6kuD9zDXy
Unique Performance Arts Center in West Orange has been around for over 20 years. At the beginning of March, the studio opened its new space only to close shortly after because of COVID-19.

Coming up on September 26th: @Zufall_Health is hosting an event in West Orange with free COVID testing, HIV testing, blood pressure screenings, masks, and food. Walk-ins welcome but you can pre-register by calling 973-325-2266 (ext. 381). More details here: https://t.co/omkALmO3AN

Many thanks to Jon Stewart and John Feal for being on the Hill today to advocate for burn pits legislation. We must do much, much more to address the health impacts of toxic burn pit exposure. Our service members deserve the very best care we can give them. https://t.co/Hcmeb7uoMH

I am proud that Republicans and Democrats in Congress fought to make the September 11th Victim Compensation Fund permanent this Congress, so all those suffering from health issues after 9/11 have access to the care they need and deserve.

.@ChathamTownship Residents: There will be free COVID and antibody testing tomorrow at the Municipal Building from 11:00am - 6:00pm. Register here:
https://t.co/hD9MqOFpuQ https://t.co/KWoeXiNKtO

At Tons of Toys right on the corner of Main Street, they helped customers virtually browse for the perfect gift during the height of the pandemic by sending pictures of possible toys - going above and beyond for their community when people needed them most! https://t.co/oda99q7CZb

A downtown concert is not only the perfect way to enjoy the arts, but to support our local economies, too. While in Madison, I stopped by some of their great small businesses. #MaskUpMadison and keep supporting our small business community! https://t.co/czlEvTFVQK

We're so grateful to the METC for the ways that you have found to support the community during the pandemic. Developing online curricula for our schools, the “share your story” project & holding concerts. All while dealing with the impact of COVID on your operations. Thank you!

The isolation & social distancing due to COVID have been hard on all of us. So moments like this afternoon’s concert are so needed. Thanks to the Museum of Early Trades and Crafts and the Madison Downtown Development Commission for making it happen. It is really a public service. https://t.co/kONEIF67iB

The pandemic has again tested our communities, our first responders, and our residents. We have lost too many friends and neighbors. We have seen acts of heroism and kindness, both large and small. And again, we must take care of each other, and we will get through this.

While these organizations were able to benefit from programs like the PPP, EIDL, and other grants early on during COVID, more needs to be done.

That's why I'm sponsoring the Save our Stages Act, the P4 Act, and the RESTART Act, and will work to see them signed into law.

I am impressed with the efforts local arts organizations have made to bring performances to us virtually and outdoors. It has provided so many people an opportunity to see a great play or musical performance during the pandemic.

The arts help contribute $1.2 billion to NJ’s economy annually. Supporting the arts during the pandemic is vital to both our arts community and our local economies. I'm grateful to the arts organizations in #NJ11 that joined my latest COVID response roundtable. https://t.co/gDfneTIADu

Eligibility for Economic Impact Payments is to be determined using 2018 or 2019 tax returns. But for some #NJ11 residents, the IRS decided not to issue payments in cases where the IRS determined they are ineligible based on a 2018 return, yet they qualify under their 2019 return.

I joined @SRuhle this morning to talk about the president’s comments on our service members and veterans, the struggle of parents with kids heading back to school this week, and the need for another COVID relief package: https://t.co/7ikDGGwcER

Did you know that #NJ11 is home to 17 clinical trials for COVID-19 related therapeutics and vaccinations? Looking forward to the conversation today with the US Chamber of Commerce and our Morris County Chamber of Commerce!

Register here ⬇️
https://t.co/8o4XuvUiXR https://t.co/MioDHZsMWU

Eso Artisanal Pasta in Morristown participated in one of my small business roundtables last month and their story really resonated with me. The co-founders pivoted from job losses due to COVID to launching their dream, taking the risk to reinvent themselves during this crisis. https://t.co/wJ4PBSNkgP

This bipartisan legislation is a historic investment in our open spaces, will help us jumpstart our economic recovery from the COVID-19 crisis, and will protect New Jersey’s natural resources and public lands for generations to come.

Pooled testing of COVID-19 samples can help labs meet nation-wide testing goals. It is especially valuable for areas of the country where the positivity rate is low.

I joined today with @RepMaxRose and @teammoulton to urge labs to employ pooled testing. Read more here ⬇️ https://t.co/onoTs2DuM7

Constituent Services Spotlight 🔦

Our small businesses have faced unprecedented challenges during COVID. When Villa Restaurant Group came to our office, their feedback on PPP and EIDL helped me advocate for provisions of the PPP Flexibility Act and get it signed into law. https://t.co/xwt86tsMvz
Essex Residents: COVID-19 testing is available in Livingston this Thursday from 4-6pm. Visit https://t.co/K9sGluYbLq to learn more. https://t.co/Voq4dbntxk

Mike and Breanna own Gelati by Mike - Caldwell. I was blown away with how they’ve stepped up to support the community during COVID. They have donated more than 60,000 bags of groceries to local food banks, and their work inspired others to join their efforts. 🍨 https://t.co/HBre3GKy7i

I led bipartisan legislation last year to secure $1.5B in state opioid response grant funding, as well as legislation to combat the importation of fentanyl and to promote scientific research on the epidemic. I’ll keep fighting for federal resources for NJ to tackle this issue.

We must work together to address addiction and overdose as the public health challenges that they are, end the stigma, and continue to take action at all levels of government and across our communities.

If you missed this week’s #MondayWithMikie on Resources for Veterans During COVID-19, you can watch the video below. Thank you to our fantastic panel for joining me, and more importantly, for your dedication to our veteran community. 
https://t.co/FrY7Eq1hKR

The educational opportunities they provide to students change lives. I will continue to fight for federal coronavirus funding for education, and for the additional direct state and local government funding that can support these institutions in our bipartisan #SMARTFund.

I convened a roundtable this week to hear from the presidents of colleges and universities located in #NJ11 with a focus on the impact of COVID on their operations and on their students. https://t.co/sSC3BdcuQd
Essex County Residents: Upcoming COVID-19 testing locations in Cedar Grove and Livingston this week ⬇️ https://t.co/cRJanewhgX

Many NJ residents lost power for days after Tropical Storm Isaias while already dealing with the economic impact of COVID. I joined members of the delegation in urging JCP&L to work with its customers and offer the same reimbursements available to other residents after the storm. https://t.co/CKWhZkCeGF
Thank you to Bethel Church for offering this free testing opportunity in Morristown – it is open until 4:00pm today. Details can be found on the flyer ⬇️ https://t.co/e6C8XFWXca

Constituent Services Spotlight 🔦

When Robert had trouble getting unemployment benefits during COVID-19 because of his military status, our office worked closely with the state DOL to resolve his issue quickly. https://t.co/Coisa3CPsm

Constituent Services Spotlight 🔦

John had an emergency medical procedure that should have been covered by the VA that went unpaid for years. Our team worked to ensure that his medical expenses were paid by the VA so that he could focus on his health and family. https://t.co/q5LBV5Pdbe

✅ Connect you with accredited Veterans Service Officers to help you file a new claim for benefits

✅ Help retrieve your military service and health record or get a copy of your DD Form 214

✅ Assist with issues with active duty, reserve, or retired pay or benefits

One of the most important parts of my job is to advocate for and assist veterans living in #NJ11. My office can:

✅ Assist with issues related to VA benefits including healthcare, disability, pensions, home loans, or education

✅ Check the status of claims & appeals with the VA

Our next #MondayWithMikie is tomorrow! I’ll be joined by stakeholders and providers my office works with who serve the veteran community across NJ to answer questions on issues related to healthcare, the VA, & small businesses.
 
🖥️ Click here to register: https://t.co/bro4xiKxML

Thanks @RepKevinHern for highlighting the importance of expanded telehealth and our Protect Telehealth Services Act! There is broad bipartisan support for telehealth and I'm glad to be working with you on this issue that's so important for NJ residents. https://t.co/pxaZTColKN

The announcement reflects a true collaborative effort. This will reimburse the counties for past efforts & invest in future public health measures. More needs to be done & I remain focused on advocating for further direct support for our state, our counties & our municipalities.

The fight against coronavirus requires partnership across all levels of government. Today, the Governor announced that Morris County will receive $7.1 million and Sussex County will receive $1.8 million from the state's allocation of CARES Act funding. https://t.co/zFFjDiiy1h

Our #MondayWithMikie next week will be focused on sharing resources available to veterans during the pandemic. Stakeholders and providers my team works with, who serve the veteran community, will join our panel. You can sign up on my website to join:
https://t.co/O2cdzhXhSE

I’m glad to see that the Administration rejected a proposal to cut military healthcare by $2.2 billion. The fact that this cut was proposed during a pandemic with no transparency on how the military would continue to care for service members and their families is unacceptable. https://t.co/dEasc0Fz1a

This latest CARES Act funding will help our neighbors stay in their homes during this difficult time. We must do more to ensure all residents have the resources they need to weather the economic impact of the pandemic, and I'll continue to fight for federal resources for NJ.

Our community health centers, like Zufall in #NJ11, help care for the most vulnerable members of our community. During COVID, they have gone above and beyond, like the mobile testing site I visited in Morristown in June. Thank you @Zufall_Health! #NationalHealthCenterWeek https://t.co/0CeHEbNAzi

Thanks to Hadassah Northern NJ for a great conversation on COVID-19 response, the USPS, managing a work/life balance during COVID & the importance of the US-Israel relationship. I am continually impressed with your mission of supporting Jewish values through volunteerism in NJ. https://t.co/YjQhgwjkKc

A thorough examination of the current state of PFAS science is critical to understanding the extent of the problem, cleaning up contaminated sites, addressing health effects, and setting future policy. Read our @HouseScience request for a GAO study on federal PFAS R&D efforts: https://t.co/hxmRO8jDtX

TL;DR: We need a whole of gov't response to the ongoing pandemic. The lives and livelihoods of millions of Americans are relying on it. The House passed comprehensive legislation in May. It’s time for Leader McConnell & the White House to come together and get relief to America.

There are other key areas Congress needs to address, including the eviction moratorium, a second round of economic impact payments, testing, and contract tracing. A piecemeal response does not meet the urgency of the moment.

SCHOOLS: As a working mom with 4 kids, I want all our kids to go back to school, but I want it to be safe. Nearly 25% of schools don’t have a licensed nurse. Testing, contact tracing, PPE & other safety precautions are a requirement for any safe reopening.
https://t.co/sVe3neqGSM

STATE & LOCAL AID: We need additional aid for state and local gov'ts so they can respond to the pandemic in their communities. The SMART Act I introduced with @RepPeteKing, @SenatorMenendez, and @SenBillCassidy would ensure direct support, including #NJ11.
https://t.co/pWqqFAVXeU

UI: Expanded UI is “protecting the economy from the cascading effects of a sudden drop in consumer demand” from the pandemic. This keeps some of our small businesses afloat and millions out of poverty. 
https://t.co/jSTEGhRtKM

THREAD: With 5 million cases of COVID and 163K Americans dead, Executive Orders that gut Social Security and Medicare and shift the UI cost to states don't cut it. Ignoring schools, child care, and food assistance isn’t leadership. Congress must pass a package to address:

There’s a time and a place for investing in defense. When Senate Republicans are balking at funding for SNAP benefits, unemployment insurance, and aid for state and local governments, putting $7 billion for weapons programs in a coronavirus response package is offensive. https://t.co/XvckPOOguD
